instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.820-0092: What is 820-0092? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0092</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Water damage no boot . post
threads.message:
I have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0092</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  Water damage near UB400, and bad corrosion at J6600.

Ultrasonic board, cleaned up well, and no obvious signs of damage.

When plugged in, no fan spin, but pulls 5V fo 3 seconds, ramps up to 20V @ .9 A.
After 30 seconds, settles down to .26A   After a little bit, comes back up to .5A had stays thee.

CPU gets hot, and nothing else happens.

Starting point ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0092</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Water damage no boot . post
threads.message:
Corrosion in backlight area is very dangerous.
Leakage from high voltage to data lines can kill sensitive circuits.

What is <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> voltage behavior?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0092</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Water damage no boot . post
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> Starts @ 1.04V, then drops to 0.65V after about 20 seconds

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-0092</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a Water damage no boot . post
threads.message:
Looks like board boots.
Check USB activity and external video.
Caps Lock reacts?
